• HealTrack bridges the gap between hospital care and home recovery. After discharge, patients receive personalized recovery plans through a secure mobile portal. The system sends automated medication reminders, physical therapy schedules, and follow-up checklists.
  • Nurses and doctors can monitor recovery progress through submitted digital forms or IoT-connected wearable data (like heart rate or glucose monitors). If a patient reports concerning symptoms, HealTrack automatically triggers alerts to the assigned healthcare provider or creates a teleconsultation appointment.
  • Analytics dashboards display overall patient recovery rates, readmission trends, and medication adherence statistics - empowering hospitals to improve post-care programs and reduce hospital overcrowding.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Hospitals and healthcare providers often lose visibility into a patient’s condition once they are discharged. Many patients skip follow-up visits or forget prescribed medication schedules, which can lead to complications, readmissions, or poor recovery outcomes. Traditional phone-based follow-ups are inefficient and time-consuming for healthcare staff.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Flow Designer: Automate patient follow-up workflows, reminder notifications, and escalation triggers when abnormal recovery data is reported.

Mobile App Builder: Provide an intuitive patient-facing app for submitting recovery updates, receiving reminders, and communicating with medical staff securely.

IntegrationHub (SMS & Health APIs): Integrate with wearable devices, hospital EMRs, or SMS gateways for real-time updates and alerts.

Dashboards: Track patient recovery metrics, alert frequency, and improvement trends for healthcare administrators.
